reviews.text: Nice temple.. nice atmosphere... Very neat and clean premises... I think it's because the temple is not under Devaswam board, so things are going very strict and devotee friendly. It's famous for thookkam. Huge trees in front of the temple are very attractive and it's very appreciative. Thanks go to the management team... space for parking, special auditorium for functions like marriage and all. 🙏

It's a beautiful and divine temple
I haven't actually visited there. But took some snaps from outside

The Ezhamkulam Devi Temple is dedicated to Shakti and is located in Ezhamkulam, Adoor, Kerala, India. Ezhamkulam is a village in Pathanamthitta district in Kerala. The temple is famous for Garudan Thookkam and Kettukazhcha which take place as a part of the annual Kumbha Bharani festival. The scenic beauty, the bliss of solitude and mental peace imparted by this place will ever be in the mind of a devotee who had at least been once to this place.

It is one of the most famous Temple in ezhamkulam the temple has lots of positive energy. the temple is has very pleasant environment during evening. The surrounding is very silent and it is the best place to release stress.
Nice place but no car parking area

reviews.text: One of the oldest and famous Lord Shiva temple in peringanad near adoor...and the most attraction is kettukazhcha in 10 days festival during the month of February or March every year...
Great Ambience and peaceful place.
Robust and sophisticated lab equipment that prepares technical students for industry challenges.

A Lovely Atmosphere At The Temple.The Gopuram On The Front Of The Temple Is Really Passionating The Various Religious Beliefs Of The Temple.In Front Of The Temple There Is A Huge Parking Area.The Top Layer Of The Temple Is Roofed With Copper Pieces.It Really Looks Stunning.The Temple And It's Atmosphere Gives As A Pleasant Feel .......
One of the famous Shiva temples in Pathanamthitta.Peaceful atmosphere.its positive vibe really refreshes the mind.evening time arati gives a really different vibe.

places_with_reviews.name: St. Thomas Orthodox Cathedral, Kannamkode-Adoor. (കണ്ണംകോട് പള്ളി)
places_with_reviews.address: Adoor - Kaipattoor Rd, Kannamkode, Adoor, Kerala 691523, India

reviews.text:
This is one of the ancient church in Adoor town. The church is believed to have been founded in 15th century. The cathedral is the resting in place of the revered Philipose Ramban who translated The Holy Bible for the first time to the vernacular language Malayalam. The translation was based on the Syriac version of the Bible.
The church is easily accessible from the town. There is a parish hall near to the church.

One of the greatest Malankara Orthodox churches in Adoor. Philiphose ramban, who translates the Bible into malayalam language, lies in this church. It is a pilgrimage center located in Adoor.  She has a good parking area and a very old average level auditorium.

Located in Adoor Central,near to the adoor valiyathodu.The church belongs to the Malankara Orthodix  Syrian church under 'Adoor-Kadampanad' diocese. Kannamcode Cathedral is situated in Adoor, a town in Pathanamthitta district of the Indian state of Kerala.

A peaceful pilgrim centre for worship. Dining,and parking area is small .

Access

You can easily access through public transportation.The ksrtc and private bus stand is situated near to the church.In my opinion,it is better to get down from bus  in near to  Ghandi park adoor ,then you can easily access the church within five minutes

St. Thomas Orthodox Cathedral in Kannamkode-Adoor is a truly divine place for prayer. The cathedral's tranquil surroundings and magnificent architecture create an atmosphere of deep spirituality. The warm and welcoming community here adds to the experience, making it an ideal place for worship and reflection. Highly recommend this beautiful cathedral for anyone seeking a place of serenity and prayer.
Holiness filled, ample parking space and good visibility for travellers.

places_with_reviews.name: Chennampalli Sree Dharmasastha Temple
places_with_reviews.address: 5P67+7WJ, Kayamkulam - Pathanapuram Rd, Peringanad, Kerala 691523, India

reviews.text: Temple which has soothing effect on ones mind. The temple ambience itself calms our mind. It is near the road so wheelchair accessible entrance is present.

One of the oldest Dharmasastha temple in Adoor.  This place of worship is located adjacent to Kayamkulam Punalur road and attracts lots of devotees.  Calm atmosphere, kept  neat and clean.  Respected by the local population regardless their religion.
Parking is limited ( 2-3 cars). The banyan tree there infront of the temple will give you a warm welcome and the bells resonate  with some positive vibes during pooja time.
Ayyappa swamy temple near chennampalli junction (KP Road) Along with Lord Ayyappa, Goddess Sreebhadra and goddess Annapoorneswari has equal importance here.
Kayamkulam Punaloor road side. South side of the road.  Temple is Near to chennampallil bus stop 100 meter away from Adoor High school junction.

places_with_reviews.name: Sree Parthasarathy Temple
places_with_reviews.address: 5P4J+5J2, SH 1, Parass La, Adoor, Kerala 691523, India

reviews.text: It is one of the most visited places in Pathanamthitta district. Adoor Gaja Mela is the most important 10-day festival in the temple.

The Parthasarathy Temple is very beautiful temple during the festival here with large elephants and great festivities that occur. On any other day it is a very humble temple with small surroundings and very peaceful environment.
We can get a peace of mind while visiting Sree Parthasarathy In adoor, pathanamthitta district in Kerala..

The Adoor Gajamela, is part of the ten-day annual celebration held at the Parthasarathy Temple in Adoor. The highlight of the festival is the elephant pageant. Hundreds of people throng the temple premises to witness this spectacle where around nine bedecked tuskers are paraded. The Temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna, who is also known as Parthasarathy - the charioteer of Parthan, another name for Arjuna. Arjuna is one of the five Pandava princes in the Indian epic Mahabharata.
Peaceful temple 🙏
